full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Description

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (SPAC/PSPC) invites proposals from qualified contractors to develop a Deep Automation and Artificial Intelligence training capability for the Royal Canadian Navy (RCN).

## Background

The government has collected feedback from industry stakeholders and engagement activities, which has informed the development of a refocused strategy for delivering adaptive training and maintaining sailor competency when and where required.

## Tender Details

- **Tender Reference**: WS4215386401-Doc4587515296
- **Publication Date**: May 15, 2024
- **Tender Closing Date**: December 31, 2024, at 14:00:00
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: None
- **Expected Contract End Date**: None
- **Tender Status**: Open
- **Procurement Method**: Competitive – Open Bidding
- **UNSPC Codes**:
  * 60100000: Developmental and professional teaching aids and materials, and accessories and supplies
  * 60101100: Electronic learning aids
  * 86130000: Specialized educational services
  * 86131800: Military education
  * 86141700: Educational technology
- **Regions of Delivery**: Canada

## Important Contacts

* **Contact Name**: Harold McKenny, SPAC/PSPC
* **Email**: harold.mckenny@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* **Notice URL**: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19710432?extsite=MTk3MTA0MzJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

## Notice Description

This Request for Information (RFI) aims to gather feedback on industry's current capabilities and inform the development of a new training capability. The proposed solution aims to deliver a Deep Automation and Artificial Intelligence training capability for the Royal Canadian Navy, enabling adaptive training and maintaining sailor competency when and where needed. This document provides a summary of the feedback received from the RFI and one-on-one sessions with industry stakeholders.  The contractor will have the opportunity to submit proposals for the development of this new capability. 

Note: The rewritten text maintains the essential details of the original entry while optimizing the language and format for clarity and ease of reading. It adheres to the 400-word limit and is written in a professional tone throughout.  As the summary of feedback from the RFI is not available, only a notice
